questions.question: What is described as the foundation of all knowledge?
What is the key difference between how animals and humans see the world?
questions.correct_answer: Animals see the world, but only humans truly observe by consciously separating phenomena from the continuous flow of existence.

questions.question: What three things does observation require?
questions.correct_answer: Attention, distinction, and the ability to hold something in awareness.

questions.question: What does the process of observation immediately create?
Why must we select what matters when observing?
questions.correct_answer: Because we cannot observe everything at once.

questions.question: Is the selection process in observation passive or active?
How do we construct what we see according to the lesson?
questions.correct_answer: We construct what we see through the lens of our existing concepts.

questions.question: How is the relationship between raw sensory data and conscious perception described?
What does understanding observation help us understand?
questions.correct_answer: How we create our experienced reality

questions.question: What does it mean to truly observe according to the lesson?
questions.correct_answer: To consciously separate phenomena from the continuous flow of existence.
